security: This memo details an ongoing intelligence operation and could reveal sources and methods. For example, it mentions, "I spent the evening of January 6 with Court Wood...I've been advised by Mr. Phillips to continue my relationship with Mr. Wood and I will keep your office informed of each subsequent visit." Disclosing this could compromise the operation and endanger those involved.
summary: Michael Stratton reports to C/EAB/OS about spending an evening with Court Wood, a student with pro-Castro sentiments recently returned from Cuba under the sponsorship of the FAIR PLAY FOR CUBA COMMITTEE, and that he will continue the relationship and inform the office of subsequent visits.
summary_one_paragraph: On February 11, 1961, Michael Stratton, WH/4/Registry, sends a memo to C/EAB/OS, attn: Mr. Belt, via WH/L/Security, attn: Mr. Kennedy, regarding the FAIR PLAY FOR CUBA COMMITTEE. At the request of Mr. Dave Phillips, C/WH/4/Propoganda, Stratton spent the evening of January 6 with Court Wood, a student who recently returned from Cuba under the sponsorship of the FPCC, and whose father also holds strong pro-Castro sentiments. Stratton has been advised to continue his relationship with Wood and will keep the office informed of subsequent visits, forwarding the memo as a matter of information for his security file.
title: FAIR PLAY FOR CUBA COMMITTEE
